code_General.utilities.basics.handleTooManyRequestsError(callToAPI)¶

Calls the function and checks, if there were too many requests. If so, repeat the request until it’s done. :param callToAPI: Function call to Auth0 API :type callToAPI: Lambda func :return: Either an error, or the response :rtype: Exception | JSON/Dict

code_General.utilities.basics.findFirstOccurence(iterable, default=False, pred=None)¶

Returns the first true value in the iterable.

If no true value is found, returns default

If pred is not None, returns the first item for which pred(item) is true.

Parameters:

  • iterable (iterable object) – The object (list, …)

  • default (depends) – The default returned, mostly None

  • pred (function) – A lambda function which an element of the list must fulfill

Returns:

Element or default

Return type:

depends

code_General.utilities.basics.checkIfNestedKeyExists(dictionary: dict, *keys) → bool¶

Check if nested keys exist in a dictionary. Equivalent to: if key1 in dictionary and key2 in dictionary[key1] and …

Parameters:

  • dictionary (dict) – The dictionary in question

  • keys (Any) – Key Parameters, must be in order

Returns:

True if all keys are in Dictionary

Return type:

bool

code_General.utilities.basics.getNestedValue(dictionary: dict, *keys)¶

Check if nested keys exist in a dictionary and return the final value. Equivalent to: if key1 in dictionary and key2 in dictionary[key1] and … dictionary[key1][key2]…[keyN]

Parameters:

  • dictionary (dict) – The dictionary in question

  • keys (Any) – Key Parameters, must be in order

Returns:

The last value if all keys are in Dictionary, None if not

Return type:

Any | None

class code_General.utilities.basics.ExceptionSerializerGeneric(instance=None, data=empty, **kwargs)¶

Bases: rest_framework.serializers.Serializer

The BaseSerializer class provides a minimal class which may be used for writing custom serializer implementations.

Note that we strongly restrict the ordering of operations/properties that may be used on the serializer in order to enforce correct usage.

In particular, if a data= argument is passed then:

.is_valid() - Available. .initial_data - Available. .validated_data - Only available after calling is_valid() .errors - Only available after calling is_valid() .data - Only available after calling is_valid()

If a data= argument is not passed then:

.is_valid() - Not available. .initial_data - Not available. .validated_data - Not available. .errors - Not available. .data - Available.

message¶
exception¶
class code_General.utilities.basics.VersioningForHandlers(allowedVersions)¶

Bases: rest_framework.versioning.AcceptHeaderVersioning

GET /something/ HTTP/1.1 Host: example.com Accept: application/json; version=1.0

code_General.utilities.basics.checkVersion(version=0.3)¶

Checks if the version is supported or not. If not, returns an error message.

Parameters:

version (Float) – Version of the API to check if it is supported or not

Returns:

Response whether the version is supported or not

Return type:

HTTPRespone
